titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marjorie Content Papers and Photographs
titlestmt.author: by Molly Wheeler

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:53

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Marjorie Content Papers and Photographs include correspondence, writings, printed material, and photographs that document the personal and professional life of American photographer Marjorie Content.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from J. Howard Woolmer Rare Books and Susan Sandberg on the Elizabeth Wakeman Dwight Memorial, 1999 and from Jill Quasha on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Funds, 2001.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 5 (film negatives): Restricted fragile material. Corresponding photograph prints are in Box 4.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Marjorie Content Papers and Photographs is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Marjorie Content Papers and Photographs. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
The collection received preliminary processing at the time of acquisition. Further organization, rehousing, and description were carried out in 2012.

The collection is comprised of material formerly classed as: Uncat ZA MS 621 and Uncat MSS 103. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, according to month and year of acquisition.
"The Story of the Armory Show," by Walt Kuhn was identified as missing from the papers during 2012 processing.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during basic processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Marjorie Content Papers and Photographs include correspondence, writings, printed material, and photographs that document the personal and professional life of American photographer Marjorie Content.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: I. May 1999 Acquisition. II. January 2001 Acquisition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, writings, printed material, and photographs by, to, or relating to Marjorie Content. Includes letters from Alfred Stieglitz, Georgia O'Keeffe and others, notes on her husband Jean Toomer, and theater programs.
Former call number: Uncat ZA MS 621

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Correspondence and Other Papers.

did.unittitle: United States. Department of the Interior. Office of Indian Affairs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript drafts of writings, early journal of Content's, and photographs

did.unittitle: Theatrical "career" including material on Theatre Guild, Special Matinees, The Miracle, and Sunwise Turn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs of members of the Toomer family and photographs from Content's travel to India.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Toomer Family Photographs and "Year in India" Photographs and Film Negatives.

did.unittitle: 42 photographs of Jean Toomer and the Toomer family

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Many with manuscript annotations on verso.

did.unittitle: "Year in India" Photographs and Film Negatives

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 5 (film negatives): Restricted fragile material. Corresponding photograph prints are in Box 4.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs and negatives are housed in numbered envelopes. Numbers preceding photograph and negative descriptions correspond to the numbers on envelopes. All photographs have corresponding negatives unless otherwise noted. Numbers following descriptions represent the numbered prints and negatives. Photographs have manuscript annotations on verso.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven negatives without prints: #18-24. These negatives were scanned and surrogate copies are filed with the prints.

did.unittitle: 5: M. S. Balorean sailed August 4 from Southampton #62-82
30: Agra Fort I #396-416 containing Golden Pavilons, views toward Taj, Mina Mosque
31: Agra Fort II. #417-439 containing Hall of Public Audience, Mirror Palace, Big Court, Peal Mosque, Exit- JT
36: Leaving Bombay on The Anyo Maru #477-485

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 5 (film negatives): Restricted fragile material. Corresponding photograph prints are in Box 4.

did.unittitle: Wooden box that originally contained photographs and negatives

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Corresponding photographic prints are in Box 4. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
